reference.title: Conditional functions
reference.shortdesc: Conditional functions evaluate expressions to determine if the values and formulas meet the specified condition. The following tables list the conditional functions for unknowns and numbers.

section.title: Conditional functions for unknowns
section.p: The following functions are conditional functions for unknowns.

strow.stentry: Evaluates the all the expressions and finds the first non-NULL, non-MISSING, non-NaN, non-infinite numeric value.
Evaluates and finds the first non-MISSING value.
Evaluates and finds the first non-MISSING, non-NULL value.
Evaluates and finds the first non-NULL value.
If value1 equals value2 return MISSING, otherwise value1.
If valuel1 equals value2, return NULL, otherwise value1.

section.title: Conditional functions for numbers
section.p: The following functions are conditional functions for numbers.

strow.stentry: Evaluates and outputs the first non-infinite value (+ or -).
Evaluates and outputs the first non-NaN value.
Evaluates and outputs the first non-NaN, non-infinite value.
Evaluates and outputs the first non-infinite value.
Evaluates and outputs the first positive non-infinite value.
If value1 equals value2, outputs NaN, otherwise value1.
If value1 equals value2, outputs negative infinity, otherwise value1.
If value1 equals value2, outputs negative infinity, otherwise value1.
If value1 equals value2, outputs positive infinity, otherwise value1.
